"SECOND MODEL SAFETY AUTOMATIC   HAMMER REVOLVER" - - -1896-1908  Double top-post barrel latch. Has barrel-facing owl head hard rubber grips, sn V22619. Think of it as one of the original low-cost, mass-market compact handguns. And then think of it as old.  Half 19th-Century cowboy, half 20th-Century modern revolver. It’s cool in that “look how well engineered things used to be” sort of way.
FRAME: Steel, Nickel finish (little finish left)
BARREL: 3” steel 
SIGHTS: Fixed rear notch, fixed front blade 
TRIGGER: Double action, Hard, Smooth
GRIPS: Hard rubber “owl head” (Iver Johnson trademark)
WEIGHT (empty): 13.5 ounces

Blackpowder ammo not readily unavailable.

title: For Trade:  Glock 22 RTF2 LE
postcontent:
I was lucky enough to find one of these NEW at my LGS last week.  Fired a full mag thru it and shot flawless..  This is the RTF2 (Rough Texture Frame) model with Scalloped slide. Glock manufactured these at the end of the Generation 3 run as a special edition.  They had a Law Enforcement package in the G22RTF2 that came with >>3<< factory 15 rd mags instead of the standard 2 and factory Glock night sights..  This is one of them.  I recently saw the new FDE Glocks and am set on getting one..  This is where the trade comes in..  I am looking for a Nice condition Gen 4 Glock 17/22 FDE for even trade or a Gen 4 G20/21 FDE and I add $50 with my Gen 3 G22RTF2.  You won't be disappointed in this G22 as the slide serrations and RTF frame add extra grip and are in much demand since being discontinued.  Thanks for looking  
If you are worried about cost/worth going from Gen3-Gen4.  My G22RTF2 was $550+tx.. That was last weekend.   Same price as the Gen4 G17/22 FDE  (unless your LGS is price gouging)

location: 3920 N. Academy Blvd., Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
We have a 1950's Great Western Arms Company single action revolver for sale. It is chambered in .38 special. It comes as shown. These hard to find revolvers were made from the early 1950's to the mid 1960's in Los Angeles, CA. These were featured prominently in western movies back when they were being produced. For all we know John Wayne could have used this same revolver in Rio Bravo (but we are sure he didnt).  Price would be higher but at some point someone has worked on this. They left a couple of tool marks on it. The lockup is tight and the bore is in good shape. We will guarantee in good shooting order. 

Asking $400.00 or best offer. Shipping is available. Trades welcome. Must be 21yrs or older and pass a background check.

title: For Trade:  S&W .38 spl Victory Snub
postcontent:
This Victory model S&W revolver is a real piece of history.  This model was shipped to England to be used by our allies, and after the WWII, was sent back to the US, had the barrel shortened, re-chambered to .38 Special, and sold commercially.  This revolver has a V prefix and SN range 505XXX.  The SN's on the butt, cylinder and extractor match.  This is a nice piece of history, but I'm looking to find something different.

This gun shoots, but does have two issues.  The first is that the front sight post is off center by a degree or two, as shown in the pic.  The second is that one of the teeth on the star is a little worn, and it will every so often not index the cylinder properly.  

I want to only trade.  If I can't find a trade I will keep this in the nightstand, but if there is someone who would like it for what it is, I would be happy to hear trade offers.

Willing to trade for most types of handguns
Kel-Tec P3AT
12 or 20 Ga coach gun
Mossberg Maverick '88 Security




Please no Hi-Points, Jennings, Lorcin, etc.

title: For Sale:  Tactical Saiga 12 Fully Built Out and Two Tone Cerakote Finish
location: Central St. Pete, Tampa/St. Pete, Florida
postcontent:
THIS GUN HAS SOLD. 

We will leave the ad up though because we can build the same gun for you and have it ready for delivery in 10 days or less. We have several unconverted S-12's in stock and will build to your specs. Prices start at $950 and go up depending on the accessories you want added to the gun. 


In the past all our Saiga 12's were the minimum build to keep the price below $1000. We decided to build this one out a little more and use it as an example in the shop to show customers various options. However we have decided to just take a bunch of photos and video and put this fine Saiga 12 up for sale. So here is what you are buying.  Brand New in the box fully 922r compliant Saiga 12 gauge. This gun was converted by DNS Guns & Suppressors a FFL 07 manufacturer of fine weapons. Fully cerakoted for optimum rust protection and durability.



All steel parts were removed and media blasted then coated with type H baked coating. Old trigger group pin holes are welded up for clean look.  Conversion consisted of Tapco G2 trigger system, pistol grip, M4 6 position rear stock, RAM Trigger guard,12 round magazine. Quad rail hand guard with removable covers, this will allow you to add any extra accessories you can think of, Halo sight system but you can still use factory sights. Even though it's not in the photos there will be a Tac-47 auto gas system installed, a Red Jacket door breaching and flash suppression muzzle device. All contact parts were smoothed out prior to coating for maximum reliability with low powered shells. We guarantee this gun to shoot the cheapest crap shells wally world sells and not only shoot them but because of the auto plug you can mix shells up in the same magazine and shoot all of them without any issues.   
This is a 19" barrel. All factory function including the bolt hold open have been installed in this conversion. Modifications were made so the side safety can be removed without tearing the gun apart. The trigger pull is a fantastic 2.5 pounds for rapid fire use.  All factory parts removed during the conversion GO WITH THE GUN. This includes the rear stock, hand guard, and 5 round magazine.  Shipping will actual shipping costs to your FFL via least expensive carrier. Or you can pick it up at our location.   

Features: 
Two tone flat dark earth andj Black Cerakote Finish 
6 position Stock   
Pistol Grip   
Modified Tapco G2 Trigger   
Modified Slide Lock   
Halo Sight   
Quad Rail Hand Guard   
Red Jacket Door Breacher and Flash Suppressor   
Tac-47 Auto Gas System 
12 Round Magazine 

Lowest price you will find on a fully converted Saiga 12 anywhere with this finish and features. 


We have several of these guns in stock and can build to your specs and colors if this is not the gun your looking for.

title: For Sale:  German WWII Flare Gun, large 25mm bore, nice Cond
postcontent:
Hello,
I have a nice working 25 mm flare pistol for sale. It's of German manufacturer, model LP42 (Leuchpistole 42), manufactured by C. u. W. Meinel-Scholer, Klingenthal, Sachsen, Germany. It has "eun" stamped on one side, along with a serial number of 165033. It's equipped with a lanyard ring and exposed hammer (very cool), with a trigger/hammer block safety (so it can be left loaded, but can not be accidently slam-fired by dropping on hammer). It locks up tight and shoots well. Fires 25 mm shells, still readily available. Also available are adapters (inserts) that allow it to shoot 12 g. and other pistol and rifle calibers, since the action on this flare pistol is very strong.  Also comes with a watertight storage box.
One like it can be seen at Webster Guns at http://websterguns.com/wwii-flare-gun-p-14840.html
